english: I am going to the village tomorrow.
notes: me=I, savar=tomorrow, taanden=to village, jaayevalo chu = will be going

english: Can you give me some water?
notes: mann-me, channik-some, paani-water, dechi ge - can you give
aaj-today, bus-bus, deer eeti - will be late, aaveche-come.
mann-i, sabji-vegetables, leer che- want to take
mann-me, aant-hear, aai koni - cant / did not
suraj-sun, ghano-very, taato che- is hot

english: Cows are grazing in the field.
notes: gavdi-cows, kheteermai- inside field, khad-grass, khareeche- are eating
ee-this, aalu re-pototo's, kai-what, bhaav che - rate/price/value
manne-I, ek kilo - 1 KG, chaaval-rice, chavche-want
taar-you, kan-near, doodh-milk, che ge - have?

english: I will not pay this much.
notes: me-i, attra-this much, bhanduni-will not pay
ee-this, dukan-shop, khulla-open, che ge - is
Tu-you, kanna-when, bandh-close, karechi-will you do
maar vasu - for me, chaai-tea, kar-do
jhaaduvun-to plants/ to trees, paani-water, ghaal-put/serve
bus stand-bus stand, kath che-where is

english: I want to go to Hyderabad.
banjara: mann hyderabad en jaavnu ken che
notes: mann-i, hyderabad en - to hyderabad, jaavnu-to go, ken che-want to
katra-how, duur-far, che vu- is it
rail gaadi - train,  aayen-to come, deer-late, veejavche-will be/ will happen
me-i, aaj-today, jaldi-early/fast/quick, uutonchu - woke up/ stand up

banjara: mee kaal raath deereethi suutho tho
notes: mee-i, kaal-yesterday, raath-night, deereethi - late/ with late, suutho tho - had slept

english: Greetings! to all the banjara people.
banjara: se gormati banjara vun ram ram
column7: ram ram-greetings/good morning/ good night/ equavalant to namestey

english: You have seen his white flag flying in every thanda.
banjara: tam se vor dholo jhanda vader har tanderma deetez viyo

english: You have heard stories from your grandparents.
banjara: tam baap dadavur kan vor kahani samlez viyo

english: But do you know the complete story?
banjara: panan tameen puuro kahani maalam chege?

english: Do you know why he is called Maharaj?
banjara: tameen von Maharaj ken kashen kach ko maalam che ge?

english: Do you know what he did for our community?
banjara: Aapner samajeer vasu vu kaai keedoch ko maalam che ge?

audio_file: puuro parikshan karan malam kide jakon itihaas che

notes: maar banjara bhai bhiyavo an bheno

english: For 220 years, our community has preserved his memory.
banjara: de see vees varas eeti, apner samaj vor yaadeevun gokan rakad melech
notes: de see-two hundred, vees-twenty, varas-years, eeti-from, apner-our, samaj-community, vor-his, yaadeevun-memories, gokan-hide/store, rakad-keep, melech-did

english: But many of us know only fragments of his story.
banjara: panan, apner ma shenduvun kahanier tukdaz malam che
notes: panan-but, apner ma-within us, shenduvun-all of us, kahanier-of story, tukdaz-pieces/fragments, malam che-know

banjara: apnen vu bhagvan che kethanin maalam.
notes: apnen-we/us, vu-he/him, bhagvan-givine/god/godly, che, kethanin-said so, maalam-know.

english: We know he reformed our community.
banjara: Vuz aapner samajeen sudharooch ken bhi maalam
notes: Vuz-he, aapner-our, samajeen-community/society, sudharooch-reformed/made it right/arranged, ken-that, bhi-also, maalam-know

english: We know he gave us dignity.
But today, we present the complete, documented history.
banjara: Panan aaj, aapan voor itihaaser maieer puuro kahani ne dhekevaal cha
notes: Panan-but aaj-today, aapan-we, voor-his, itihaaser-of history, maieer-inside of, puuro-complete/total/all, kahani ne-story/documentry, dhekevaal cha-going to watch/present

english: And oral histories passed down through generations.
banjara: katriko peedivuthi ee kahanevun ekeeti ek en keethe aarecha
notes: katriko-somany, peedivuthi-generations, ee-this, kahanevun-stories, ekeeti ek en - one after the other/one by one, keethe-saying/said, aarecha-coming/doing

banjara: ee aapner ithaazer mai eek heerar naai

english: This is the story of Sant Sevalal Maharaj.
banjara: anne eez apner sant sevalal maharaj eer kahani

english: Our Maharaj was born on 15 February 1739.
notes: pandre february satre sao theesan nav eermai janmotho.
column10: thee san nav - thirty and nine

banjara: ee taarik peenar kittabevur mai lakmeelech

english: But his exact birthplace remains a matter of scholarly debate.
banjara: panan janmo jakon jaageer par aaj bhi mot aadmivurma behas vache
column11: mot aadmivurma-elderly men/ old men/ respectable men/ scholarly men

english: Karnataka claims Surgondankoppa in Shimoga district.
Official government records support this location.
banjara: sarkaareevur dastaveezurmai bhi vu jaageer naam lakhmeleche.

english: Andhra Pradesh claims Sevagad in Anantapur district.
audio_file: sevagad eer mai janmoch keen kache
timestamp: andhra pradesh eer mai-in andhra pradesh

english: Traditional Lambadi bards and oral histories support this location.
column13: itihaaseer hisabheti dooi vathe sahiz che

english: The discrepancy reflects our community's nomadic nature during that period.
banjara: ee vaath apner samaj eema jaag jaag pahrer savabbaveen dikaalec.

english: What matters most is not WHERE he was born.
banjara: Katth huyoch kajako motto vaath koni

english: But WHAT he achieved for our people.
banjara: panan vuu apner mankavur vasu kai kamayo kajakoneez motto vaath.

english: 15 February 1739 marks the birth of our greatest reformer.
banjara: pandre february satre soo thees an nav kajakon daado eek mooto nayak eer daadoor ken harde rejjavche

english: Sant Sevalal Maharaj came from a distinguished Rajput lineage.
notes: Rajput eer veeler maai thi aayoche

column8: Bheema Naik Ramavath Rathod - Bheema Naik Ramavath Rathod

timestamp: katti katti dharmani mata ken bhi kache

column7: Ramji Naik Rathod- Ramji Naik Rathod

audio_file: ajji shiv rathod ken bhi naam paad melech

banjara: ghar eer naam rathod kejermaaz katraiko mahatv che

english: It connects our community to the Rajput warrior clans of Chittorgarh.
notes: chittorgarh eer rajput yoddhavur jaatheema bhelech

english: We are descendants of those who served Rana Pratap.
banjara: apan Maha Rana Pratap een seva karmele jakon vansaj cha
audio_file: Maha Rana Pratap een-Maha Rana Pratap's
sirsigad eer kann sevalal gaavdi chratho tho

english: A simple life of service and devotion.
banjara: seva an bhakthi thi banchmelo jakon saada zindagi

english: Until the miracle that would establish his divinity.
banjara: jannaz sevalal eer maithi chamatkar baar padi

english: This event is recorded in the traditional epic Sevabhaya.
banjara: hannu vee jakon apner itihaaser mai chapgiche

english: Recited by Lambadi bards for centuries.
banjara: varsuthi gor maativur gaanavu ma reegiech
audio_file: gor maativur - gor mati/ lanjara/ lambada

english: Young Sevalal was by a stream near Sirsigad.
He felt the presence of Goddess Jagadamba.
banjara: Voon votthe Jagadamba devi che ju anubhav vi

english: Also known as Goddess Mariamma Yaadi.
banjara: voonaz Devi mariamma yaadi ken bhi kach

english: He wished to offer her something.
notes: vu devi ne kai thoi chadavnu ken lago

banjara: panan vor kan kaai vetto koni.

english: So he took mud and wheat.
banjara: tho haatherma dhud an gahu leedho

english: And offered them to the goddess.

notes: the mud transformed into real sheera.
column7: dhud asli sheera re nai badalgo

banjara: ghao jakon asli puri re nai badalgo

english: This miracle established his divine nature.
banjara: ee chamatkar eethi vor mai deever nai che jako svabhaav baar padi

english: Those who witnessed this miracle understood immediately.
banjara: hannu veejanna kun kun dite ko vondun jannaz samaj aavgi

english: This was not an ordinary child.

banjara: Jagadamba deevi reej aashirvaad che keen
he was recognized as spiritually awakened.
audio_file: vo se deeveer nai dheken lagpade.
